title: Operando Liquid-cell Transmission Electron Microscope Sample Holder with Bulk Reference and Counter Electrodes for Electrocatalysis Applications
content: The need to investigate relationships between the structure and chemical composition of energy material and catalyst systems and their performance has spurred the adoption of liquid cell transmission electron microscopy (LC-TEM) towards dynamic operando studies of electrochemical reactions. The development of new scientific hardware and methods is critical to advancing in-situ nano-scale liquid cell microscopy and spectroscopy of these reactions. Traditional LC-TEM electrochemical cells employ a three-electrode geometry where the working, reference and counter electrodes are patterned on the chip. In this case, the reference electrode is known as a pseudo-reference. Due to exposure of the pseudo-reference to the electrolyte and reaction environment, it can have a limited stability window, which leads to shifts in the reference potential over extended experiments. This issue is further exacerbated by the limited liquid volume in the LC-TEM cells [1].
